attributes.action: compel all housing associations to fine any contractor who fails to carry out an adequate job of work.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many housing association tenants are subject to a deplorable standard of repair and maintenance work carried out by local contractors who are not up to the job.

This often requires remedial work to be carried out causing more inconvenience and problems for the tenant, whilst allowing the contractor to waste more and more of the tenant’s time and the housing association’s money.

Housing associations are generally disinterested in any inconvenience to their tenants (a disabled relative of mine was left without any means to get washed other than a tiny bathroom sink, for over three months last year due to inadequate repair work).

If contractors were fined for not doing a proper job of work, they would eventually ensure that they did so, first time, every time.

As the housing associations will never voluntarily do this, they need to be compelled to do so by law.

We therefore petition the Prime Minister bring legislation forward to compel all housing associations to fine any contractor who fails to carry out an adequate job of work. The fine being the original cost of the works agreed plus a 500% penalty surcharge.
